title: Magnetic field - near a current-carrying wire

content.question: Two current carrying wires are arranged as shown. Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> carries a current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> directed toward the bottom of the page. Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is positioned to the right of Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and is oriented perpendicular to Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> carries a current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> out of the page. Which of the following correctly describes the net force exerted on Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> by Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and provides the correct justification?

choices.label: Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> experiences no net force from Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> because Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is oriented perpendicular to Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and there are no forces exerted on Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> experiences no net force from Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> because the forces exerted on Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> by Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> sum to zero.

The net force on Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> will point toward Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> because the magnetic field produced by Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> in the region containing Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> produces a net force on Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> to the left by the right hand rule.

The net force on Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> will point toward Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> because current carrying wires placed near each other will always attract each other.

content.answer: Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> experiences no net force from Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> because the forces exerted on Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> by Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> sum to zero.
